articles.author: dzanemorris
articles.title: MWC, the world’s biggest mobile phone show, is cancelled over coronavirus fears
articles.description: The biggest mobile phone conference in the world was called off after major phone manufacturers backed out, fearing attendees would be at risk for coronavirus exposure.

articles.author: Isaac Feldberg
articles.title: ‘Contagion’ writer, scientific adviser reflect on film’s newfound relevance amid coronavirus crisis
articles.description: Scribe Scott Z. Burns and researcher Larry Brilliant explain how they concocted the movie's virus and how fear distorts our response to outbreaks.

articles.author: Adrian Croft
articles.title: Luxury goods mogul Bernard Arnault was briefly crowned ‘world’s richest man.’ Then coronavirus struck
articles.description: “Let’s not panic, let’s analyze the situation calmly," the LVMH CEO told analysts last month.

articles.author: Adrian Croft
articles.title: SARS battered the luxury goods sector in 2003. Why coronavirus could be worse. Far worse
articles.description: The Chinese consumer is a force in the $300 billion luxury goods market, accounting for 35% of the global market—and most of its growth. It was just 2% at the time of the SARS epidemic.

articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: Carnival cruise ship rejected by 5 nations on coronavirus fears has finally found a port to dock in
articles.description: The liner will reach Sihanoukville, Cambodia, at 7:00 a.m. local time on Thursday, Holland America Line, the operator of the ship, said.

articles.author: Jeff
articles.title: My boss wants me to travel during the coronavirus. Do I have to go?
articles.description: The short answer, according to legal experts, is that workers can't cite the coronavirus outbreak as a reason not to carry out their ordinary duties—including travel.

articles.author: Karen Yuan
articles.title: ‘Jail, with the chance of being drowned’—more turmoil at sea for the virus-stricken cruise ship sector
articles.description: Travel and tourism are among the most vulnerable sectors to the coronavirus outbreak. That can be seen in precipitous fall of cruise-line stocks.

articles.author: Grady McGregor
articles.title: How is China experiencing the coronavirus outbreak? Almost entirely online
articles.description: More so than in past outbreaks, the Internet is offering a lifeline to Chinese residents on lockdown.
